detaileddescription.para:
Handles the initial request message. Selects the appropriate server command to execute based on the first argument in the message ["command", request={"arg1": val1, "arg2": val2, ...}]
Success: command(request)
Unrecognized command: [1, {"message": m}]
Create a figure based on the parameters provided in args.

parameterdescription.para: (String) The unique handle for the figure being created.
(String) QML string declaring the layout of the figure. See more in ().

detaileddescription.para: Layout parameter controls based on the parameters provided in args.

parameterdescription.para: A dictionary of args. {"figureHandle": f, "qml": qml]
(String) The unique identifier of the new figure
(String) Should describe the layout of the controls used for adjusting parameter values related to figureHandle.

detaileddescription.para: Check whether the given full handle is valid.

parameterdescription.para: Full handle to any Nutmeg object.

detaileddescription.para: Find and return the full handle of the child of parentHandle, with the handle, childHandle.

parameterdescription.para: The full handle of a figure or axis.
The handle name of the child.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the data or properties of plotHandle according the values stored in dataDict. Multiple objects can be referenced using Python-style pretty indexing (see below).

For a single set of data, dataList should be a 1D list. For a multiple sets of data destined for multiple axes or plots, dataList should be a 2D list, regardless of the number of data points. Where the first dimension contains a list for each dataset. In the following example, a figure has an axis group of 3 (so they have the same handle). Each axis contains a line plot with the handle "myData":

parameterdescription.para: The hierarchical handle to the plot of interest (e.g. myFigure.axis[0].experiment1Data)
The data dictionary should contain one or both of "x" and "y" data for a 2D plot (e.g. {"x": [0,1,2], "y": [2,4,1]})
Optional argument which informs the server which changing parameter that this update is in response to. See Socket Architecture for details

detaileddescription.para: Server handles requests from Nutmeg clients.
